IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FIGHTING HUNGER, IMPROVING LIVES, STRENGTHENING COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO SOLVE HUNGER IN CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA BY ENSURING THAT EVERYONE STRUGGLING WITH HUNGER HAS ACCESS TO ENOUGH WHOLESOME FOOD EVERY DAY. WE WILL ACHIEVE THIS BOLD GOAL WITH THE HELP OF OUR GENEROUS DONORS, VOLUNTEERS AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS.
IRS990.Desc: FIGHTING HUNGER: CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA FOOD BANK (CPFB) CONTINUED MAKING PROGRESS TOWARDS THE BOLD GOAL OF ENDING HUNGER IN CENTRAL PA BY THE YEAR 2025, WHILE CONTINUING TO RESPOND TO CHANGING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS RESULTING IN A GROWING NEED ACROSS CENTRAL PA. IN FY2023, CPFB PROVIDED NEARLY 57 MILLION MEALS IN CENTRAL PA. CPFB CURRENTLY SERVES MORE THAN 470,000 PEOPLE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OVER 1,200 COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN 27 COUNTIES. CPFB ALSO MAINTAINED EXCELLENT STEWARDSHIP: ADMINISTRATIVE & FUNDRAISING COSTS COMPRISED ONLY 3% OF OUR TOTAL EXPENSES, AND 97% OF EXPENSES WERE INVESTED INTO OUR PROGRAMS. CPFB ALSO RECEIVED SIGNIFICANT FINANCIAL SUPPORT DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, AND THIS SUPPORT CONTINUES TO HELP THE FOOD BANK AS INFLATION CONTINUES TO CHALLENGE OUR COMMUNITIES AS OUR ECONOMY RECOVERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: IMPROVING LIVES: CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA FOOD BANK, AN INNOVATOR IN THE FEEDING AMERICA NETWORK, IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE LIVES OF PEOPLE IN NEED. WE CONTINUED TO EXPAND HEALTHCARE PARTNERSHIPS FOCUSED ON IMPROVING HEALTH OUTCOMES THROUGH OUR HEALTHSHARE PROGRAM. SERVICES LIKE THE SNAP HELPLINE ASSIST WITH ENROLLMENT IN SNAP AND REFERRAL TO OTHER SERVICES. MOBILE DISTRIBUTIONS SERVED OVER 10.4 MILLION MEALS THIS YEAR, INCLUSIVE OF OUR MILITARYSHARE PROGRAM THAT FOCUSES ON VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES. YOUTH-FOCUSED PROGRAMS LIKE KIDS CAFE, BACKPACK, AND SCHOOL PANTRIES SERVED TENS OF THOUSANDS OF CHILDREN EACH WEEK, AND OUR ELDERSHARE PROGRAM REACHED OVER 5,000 SENIORS EACH MONTH. ALSO DURING FY2023, CPFB LEVERAGED THE PENNSYLVANIA AGRICULTURAL SURPLUS PROGRAM, THE MID-ATLANTIC REGIONAL COOPERATIVE, AND FARMERS, PRODUCERS,GROCERS, AND DISTRIBUTORS TO SHARE OVER 25.2 MILLION POUNDS OF NUTRITIOUS FARM PRODUCTS WITH NEIGHBORS IN NEED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: STRENGTHENING COMMUNITIES - CPFB MAINTAINS A PERMANENT ENDOWMENT DEDICATED TO STRATEGIC INITIATIVES AND BUILDING CAPACITY WITH OUR PARTNER AGENCIES. ESTABLISHED IN 2009, CPFB HAS PROVIDED OVER $5 MILLION IN FUNDING FOR CAPACITY IMPROVEMENT GRANTS FOR OUR PARTNERS, TO EXPAND OUR MOBILE DISTRIBUTION PROGRAMS, FRESH EXPRESS AND MILITARYSHARE, AND OTHER INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS. THESE PROJECTS ENABLE CPFB AND ITS PARTNERS TO SERVE MORE FRESH, NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO OUR NEIGHBORS IN NEED ACROSS CENTRAL PA. CPFB ALSO MAINTAINS A RESEARCH & DATA FUNCTION TO CONDUCT LOCAL HUNGER MAPPING AND OTHER ACTIVITIES TO HELP US BETTER SERVE OUR NEIGHBORS IN NEED AND OUR COMMUNITIES. WE ARE THANKFUL TO OUR DONORS FOR THEIR SUPPORT OF THIS VITAL WORK.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: OTHER REVENUE - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 49,272. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 224,436. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 119,989. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 179,481. 2022 AMOUNT: $ 178,101. FUNDRAISING AND GAMING - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 45,668.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ADVOCACY AGENDA SUPPORTS HUNGER RELIEF EFFORTS ANNUALLY IN HARRISBURG, PA, AND WASHINGTON, D.C.

THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS INTENDED TO SECURE THE MISSION OF THE CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA FOOD BANK FOR THE LONG-TERM FUTURE. THE INCOME FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS INTENDED TO SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATION'S STRATEGIC GOALS, WHILE THE PRINCIPAL OF THE FUND IS INTENDED TO BE PRESERVED. OVER THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS, INCOME FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUND HAS BEEN USED TO FUND CAPACITY-BUILDING PROJECTS DESIGNED TO INCREASE THE DISTRIBUTION OF FRESH FOOD ACROSS OUR 27 COUNTY TERRITORY. TO DATE, THESE PROJECTS HAVE TOTALED OVER $4.9 MILLION DOLLARS SINCE THE ENDOWMENT FUND'S INCEPTION.

THE FOOD BANK IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITY AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES ON RELATED ACTIVITIES PURSUANT TO SECTION 509(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IN ADDITION, THE FOOD BANK WAS ORGANIZED UNDER THE PENNSYLVANIA NONPROFIT CORPORATION LAW AND IS EXEMPT FROM STATE INCOME TAXES. THE FOOD BANK ADHERES TO THE PROVISIONS OF ASC 740, INCOME TAXES. ASC 740 ESTABLISHES RULES FOR RECOGNIZING AND MEASURING TAX POSITIONS TAKEN IN AN INCOME TAX RETURN, INCLUDING DISCLOSURES OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS (UTPS). ASC 740 MANDATES THAT COMPANIES EVALUATE ALL MATERIAL INCOME TAX POSITIONS FOR PERIODS THAT REMAIN OPEN UNDER APPLICABLE STATUTES OF LIMITATION, AS WELL AS POSITIONS EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN FUTURE RETURNS. THE UTP RULES THEN IMPOSE A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD ON EACH TAX POSITION. A COMPANY CAN RECOGNIZE AN INCOME TAX BENEFIT ONLY IF THE POSITION HAS A "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" (I.E., MORE THAN 50 PERCENT) CHANCE OF BEING SUSTAINED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS. FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THE FOOD BANK HAS TAKEN NO MATERIAL TAX POSITIONS ON ITS APPLICABLE TAX FILINGS THAT DO NOT MEET THE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THRESHOLD. AS A RESULT, NO AMOUNT FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOOD BANK'S FEDERAL EXEMPT ORGANIZATION INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2020.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ALLOCATES GOVERNMENT, PRIVATE, AND INTERNALLY-FUNDED GRANTS TO AGENCY PARTNERS IN ORDER TO ASSIST WITH CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECTS, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR MAINTAINING OR INCREASING SERVICE TO CLIENTS. THESE GRANTS HELP IMPROVE THE COLLECTIVE IMPACT OF THE FOOD SECURITY NETWORK AND ARE CRITICAL TO HELPING THE ORGANIZATION ACHIEVE ITS BOLD GOAL. THE ORGANIZATION HAS DEVELOPED AN ASSESSMENT AND BENCHMARKING TOOL TO MONITOR AND REPORT ON AN AGENCY'S PROGRESS TOWARDS SHARED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, WHICH IS REVIEWED IN CONJUNCTION WITH ALL GRANT REQUESTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A GRANT TRACKING MODULE THAT INTEGRATES WITH ITS CORE FOOD BANK ACCOUNTING AND OPERATING SYSTEM MODULES. ALL GRANTS ARE ASSIGNED TO ACCOUNTABLE ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF TO ENSURE PROPER OVERSIGHT AND COMPLIANCE. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO WORKS CLOSELY WITH OTHER REGIONAL FOOD BANKS AND ORGANIZATIONS OUTSIDE OF CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA, THROUGH CONTRACTUAL PARTNERSHIPS WITHIN PENNSYLVANIA AS WELL AS WITH THE BROADER FEEDING AMERICA NETWORK ACROSS THE COUNTRY. FOOD AND OTHER PRODUCTS THAT CANNOT BE READILY DISTRIBUTED OR THAT DO NOT FIT THE NEEDS OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO OTHER FOOD BANKS THAT MAY BE ABLE TO UTILIZE THESE OFFERINGS; THESE PARTNERSHIPS ALSO RESULT IN OPPORTUNITIES FOR CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA FOOD BANK TO RECEIVE ADDITIONAL PRODUCT THAT MAY NOT BE ABUNDANTLY AVAILABLE IN THE REGION, OFTEN AT A LOW COST OR NO COST. THE VALUE OF FOOD DISTRIBUTED TO PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS OUTSIDE OF CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA IS REFLECTED ON SCHEDULE I SIMILARLY TO THOSE LOCATED WITHIN CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA.
THE ORGANIZATION OCCASIONALLY RECEIVES A CONTRIBUTION IN THE FORM OF MARKETABLE SECURITIES. OUR PRACTICE IS TO HAVE OUR THIRD PARTY INVESTMENT MANAGER SELL THE ASSETS AS SOON AS IS PRACTICAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AN INACTIVE CPA, AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. THE FORM 990 WILL THEN BE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. A COPY OF THE APPROVED FORM 990 WILL THEN BE DISTRIBUTED TO ALL DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES ALL OFFICERS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, AND MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO SIGN A WRITTEN STATEMENT THAT CERTIFIES THAT HE/SHE HAS READ AND ACKNOWLEDGED THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE STATEMENT REQUIRES THAT THE OFFICER/COMMITTEE MEMBER/BOARD MEMBER DISCLOSE ANY AFFILIATIONS AND RELATIONSHIPS THAT COULD HAVE A DIRECT OR INDIRECTIMPACT ON THE ORGANIZATION. MANAGEMENT CONTINUALLY ASSESSES THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN OFFICERS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, AND BOARD MEMBERS TO ENSURE THAT ANY NEW OR EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS DO NOT CONFLICT WITH THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS. THESE INDIVIDUALS MUST INFORM THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE OF ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OR BUSINESS AND/OR FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS. SHOULD ANY CONFLICT EXIST (OR APPEAR TO EXIST) THE INTERESTED PARTY WILL REFRAIN FROM DISCUSSIONS OR VOTING ON THE PARTICULAR TRANSACTION. ANY CONFLICT THAT ARISE WOULD BE RESOLVED IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF THE ORGANIZATION BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS AND DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER (CEO) ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THIS PROCESS INCLUDES AN ANNUAL REVIEW OF THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE AS COMPARED TO GOALS ESTABLISHED IN ADVANCE BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ALSO CONSIDERS THE VALUE OF THE CEO'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE AS COMPARED TO THE COMPENSATION PACKAGES OF OTHER SIMILAR NONPROFIT EXECUTIVE POSITIONS. THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD DOCUMENTS THE REVIEW AND APPROVAL ACTIONS AND PROVIDES RELEVANT INSTRUCTIONS TO THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER TO IMPLEMENT COMPENSATION CHANGES WITH THE CEO THAT STIPULATES THE CEO'S BASE SALARY, BONUS POTENTIAL, AND EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT. CPFB GENERALLY CONDUCTS COMPENSATION REVIEWS WITH ITS STAFF, INCLUDING OFFICERS AND MANAGERS, ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE MOST RECENT PROCESS INCLUDED A REVIEW OF THE MOST RECENT ISSUANCES OF THE "NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS NATIONWIDE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS PARTICIPATION REPORT" (THE NONPROFIT TIMES) AND "COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS SURVEY" ISSUED BY FEEDING AMERICA. THESE SOURCES ARE CONSIDERED AS MOST RELEVANT FOR LARGE FOOD BANKS LIKE CPFB. CPFB ALSO CONDUCTS ANNUAL PERFORMANCE APPRAISALS FOR ALL EMPLOYEES. CPFB'S INDEPENDENT REVIEW, DELIBERATION, AND APPROVAL WILL BE CONDUCTED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
ADJUSTMENT TO NET ASSETS AS A RESULT OF ADOPTION OF FASB ASC 842 -156,773.
THE FINANCE COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF ANY AUDIT, REVIEW, OR COMPILATION OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.
